business.headline: EPF, NPS can build Rs 12 crore retirement fund. Tax expert breaks it downFor salaried individuals earning up to Rs 14.65 lakh annually, Bangar believes this combination offers the best of both worlds: zero tax under the new regime and long-term wealth creation.
Sensex opens 82 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Bajaj Finance up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 46.97 points to 83,286.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 14.45 points to 25,419.75 as of 9:22 am.

HCLTech joins hands with OpenAI to take AI to businessesThe collaboration aims to help global companies adopt AI at scale, combining HCLTech's industry experience with OpenAI's advanced AI models and tools.

Global trading firm Jane Street banned by Sebi from securities marketAccording to an order published on Sebi's website, the regulator has ordered the seizure of Rs 48.4 billion (approximately $570 million), which it claims is the total amount of illegal profit made by Jane Street.

DA hike July 2025: 4% increase likely for central government employeesDearness Allowance is revised twice a year, in January and July. It is based on the average of All India Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (AICPI-IW) data over the past 12 months.

Nvidia to become world's most valued company ever with $3.9 trillion market capNvidia is set to become the most valuable company ever, reaching a $3.92 trillion market cap amid soaring AI demand. Its dominance in AI chipmaking has fuelled rapid growth, outpacing rivals like Apple and Microsoft.

IndiGo appoints former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as non-executive directorIndiGo has appointed former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as a Non-Executive Director on its board, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.

RBI bars foreclosure charges on floating rate loans to micro, small businessesAccording to the new rules, no prepayment charges will be allowed on floating rate loans to MSEs or to individuals borrowing for business purposes.

How poor is 'poor' in India?Millions of Indians have exited extreme poverty, yet many still live one crisis away from hunger, debt, or despair. In this deep dive, we examine why poverty is retreating in numbers, but not in reality.

Meesho files confidential papers for IPO to raise Rs 4,250 crore: ReportMeesho is a well-known player in India's booming e-commerce space, taking on giants like Amazon and Flipkart, with big global investors such as Prosus, Elevation Capital, WestBridge Capital, SoftBank, and Peak XV Partners backing it.
Sensex settles 170 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Maruti down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 170.22 points to end at 83,239.47, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 48,10 points to close at 25,405.30.

Don't set and forget: Why your SIPs need regular check-upsWhile the idea of 'set it and forget it' may seem peaceful, doing so could lead to long-term underperformance, missed opportunities, or even a shortfall in your retirement goals.

entertainment.headline: Anshula Kapoor gets engaged, brother Arjun and sisters Janhvi, Khushi show loveAnshula Kapoor announced her engagement to longtime boyfriend Rohan Thakkar. They met on a dating app in 2022 and got engaged in New York.

Salman Khan's cryptic Hunar Ka Pehelwan post sparks buzz, fans predict comebackSalman Khan recently shared a picture of himself with an intense look on social media. Fans are predicting a comeback seeing his cryptic caption.

The Hunt review: A bold, unflinching thriller digging deep into Rajiv Gandhi caseRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025The Hunt review: Director Nagesh Kukunoor's investigative-thriller 'The Hunt', featuring Amit Sial, is streaming on Sony Liv. The show chronicles the assassination of former Indian Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi on May 21, 1991. Does the show live up to expectations?

A frame everyone will remember: AR Rahman's selfie with Hans Zimmer stirs fan frenzy'Ramayana' marks an unprecedented collaboration between music maestros AR Rahman and Hans Zimmer. Rahman shared a heartwarming selfie with the Hollywood music legend on Thursday.

Kaalidhar Laapata review: Abhishek Bachchan shines but film falls shortRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Kaalidhar Laapata movie review: The Zee5 film follows a middle-aged man with memory loss who escapes abandonment and forms a unique bond with an orphan boy. Set in Madhya Pradesh, it explores themes of abandonment and healing but misses some emotional beats.

Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom confirm separation in joint statementOrlando Bloom and Katy Perry confirmed their separation in a joint statement. Their priority remains raising their daughter with "love, stability and mutual respect".

Michael Madsen, star of 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Kill Bill', dies at 67Michael Madsen, star of 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Kill Bill', died at 67 from suspected cardiac arrest. Known for intense roles, he leaves behind a rich legacy of over 300 screen credits.

Uppu Kappurambu review: Keerthy Suresh, Suhas's quirky comedy works despite flawsRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Uppu Kappurambu movie review: Director Ani IV Sasi's 'Uppu Kappurambu', starring Keerthy Suresh and Suhas, is a quirky comedy set in a fictional village. A bizarre drama soon turns into a communal issue in this effective film.

Will never be forgotten: Shefali Jariwala's husband Parag Tyagi shares moving noteParag Tyagi shared a picture of Shefali Jariwala along with a heartfelt note on Instagram, remembering her selflessness and how she always put 'others first'. The 'Kaanta Laga' fame actor died on June 27 after suffering a cardiac arrrest.

Amitabh Bachchan reflects on 25 years of KBC, recalls first broadcastAmitabh Bachchan celebrated 25 years of Kaun Banega Crorepati, remembering the show's debut on July 3, 2000, while preparing for the new season. He shared an emotional post saying, "Didn't even realise, and 25 years just went by."

Aamir Khan rocks rugged look as Dahaa in Rajinikanth's Coolie, first look outAamir Khan's first look as Dahaa from Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' was unveiled. The actor was seen in a rugged, pipe-smoking avatar.

Amar Upadhyay on Kyunki...craze: Mobbed at Taj Mahal, got marriage proposalsActor Amar Upadhyay recently got candid about his popularity after 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi.' He shared how his character became a household name after the show aired in 2000.

Nick Jonas helps Priyanka Chopra untie her hair, fans call him green forestActor Priyanka Chopra shared a video on Thursday in which her singer-husband Nick Jonas can be seen helping her untie her hair. Looking at the video, several fans called him a green flag.

Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom release postponed again, new date to be announced soonA new release date for actor Vijay Deverakona's much-anticipated film 'Kingdom' will be announced soon. Film producer Naga Vamsi shared the latest update on his social media account.

Paranthu Po review: Charming family film teaches joy in life's simple thingsRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Paranthu Po movie review: Director Ram's 'Paranthu Po', starring Mirchi Shiva, Grace Antony and Mithul, is a profound story about self-discovery when you are busy running the city life. Without being too preachy, the film hits all the right notes.

Is The Traitors seducing new India through deception and manipulation?'The Traitors', which has already been renewed for the second season, celebrates lying and deception. Ahead of its finale tonight (July 3), here's decoding why the reality TV show is gaining popularity in India and its implications.

Bajrangi Bhaijaan's Harshali Malhotra to make South film debut with Akhanda 2Harshali Malhotra, known as Munni from 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', is making her South debut with 'Akhanda 2' alongside Nandamuri Balakrishna. She introduced her new role, Janani, through an Instagram post, marking her return to films.

Ramayana 1st glimpse: Alia Bhatt, KJo and Sargun Mehta share their excitementSeveral celebrities, including Alia Bhatt, Karan Johar and Sargun Mehta reacted to the first glimpse of the much-anticipated film 'Ramayana'. The film is slated for a theatrical release on Diwali 2026.

Kyunki...turns 25: Smriti Irani, Amar Upadhayay, Ektaa Kapoor get nostalgic'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' completed its 25-year run on July 3. On the special occasion, the cast, including Smriti Irani, Amar Upadhyay and Ektaa Kapoor shared their journey on the show.

general news.headline: Crash victims' families claim forced financial disclosures, Air India deniesAir India has been accused of coercing AI 171 crash victims' families during the compensation process. However, the airline has denied charges.

Amid deadlock over new chief, BJP may get first woman presidentThe BJP is likely to appoint a woman as its next national president, with leaders like Nirmala Sitharaman, D Purandeswari, and Vanathi Srinivasan being top contenders. The move, backed by the RSS, would mark a historic first for the party.

How British F-35 fighter jet might be dismantled, parcelled to UK from KeralaThe British navy's F-35B fighter jet stuck in Kerala for over a fortnight is reported to be beyond repair and will have to be shipped home. How are fighter jets like the F-35 dismantled and flown in bigger transport aircraft? Here's what we know.

Hang in there: Gill reveals Gambhir advice after record-breaking 269India captain Shubman Gill revealed the advice he got from Gautam Gambhir after scoring a record-breaking 269 against England on Day 2 of the Edgbaston Test. Gill broke many records on his way to the score as India posted 587 in the first innings.

Mind your language: Why linguistic battles in 'New' India won't workThose who might be fighting language wars need to realise that these are losing battles which may yield temporary political dividend but cannot be sustained beyond a point. Linguistic diversity is India's strength, being multilingual a competitive advantage.

44 injuries, brain damage: Chilling autopsy details of Tamil Nadu custodial deathThe post-mortem report of custodial death victim Ajith Kumar, accessed by India Today, reveals 44 injuries, including deep muscle contusions, brain bleeding, and internal organ trauma. The findings strongly suggest prolonged, violent physical torture leading to death.

Viral video shows Lalit Modi, Vijay Mallya singing together at lavish London partyLalit Modi and Vijay Mallya sing "I Did It My Way" at a grand London party, drawing attention for flaunting wealth despite ongoing investigations in India.

Bihar ki beti: PM Modi hails Trinidad & Tobago PM's Indian rootsDuring his Trinidad and Tobago visit, PM Modi called PM Kamla Persad-Bissessar "Bihar ki Beti" and talks about her Buxar roots.

Zohran Mamdani marked Asian and African American on college application: ReportNew York City's Democratic mayoral frontrunner Zohran Mamdani listed himself as "Asian" and "Black" on a 2009 Columbia application, citing limited options to reflect his Indian-African heritage, according to a report by The New York Times.

Indian-origin man chokes co-passenger mid-flight, arrested upon landing in USThe 21-year-old Indian-origin man was involved in a mid-air brawl with another passenger. He was arrested upon landing at Miami airport.

This is the second time in a row that Gukesh has beaten Magnus.

Blinded by love for uncle, woman gets her husband killed 45 days after weddingBlinded by love for her uncle, a woman in Maharashtra's Aurangabad plotted her husband's murder only 45 days after their wedding. Police arrested three, including the woman, namely Goonja Singh, who confessed to the conspiracy.

iPhone 17 Pro Max may get the biggest battery jump so far, new leak suggestsThe upcoming Apple flagship, the iPhone 17 Pro Max, may pack a huge battery under the hood. According to a new leak, it may break past the 5,000mAh barrier.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
